summary: This is an official letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center to two federal judges, notifying them of the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide on August 10, 2019. It details the discovery of Epstein unresponsive in his cell, the emergency response, his transport to a hospital where he was pronounced dead, and the pending investigations by the FBI and DOJ Inspector General.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around 6:30 a.m., transported to a hospital, and pronounced dead at 7:37 a.m. from an apparent suicide.

events.title: Initiation of FBI and DOJ OIG Investigations
events.description: The FBI is actively investigating the incident, and the Attorney General has requested the DOJ Office of the Inspector General to also investigate Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at approximately 7:37 a.m. at a New York hospital.
He was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around 6:30 a.m. that same day.
The cause of death was not immediately determined; an autopsy was pending at the time of the letter.
The FBI and the DOJ Office of the Inspector General were both investigating the incident.
The notification was sent to Chief Judge Colleen McMahon and District Judge Richard M. Berman, who were presiding over Epstein's case (19-cr-00490-RMB).
